aspects of Kierkegaard's work is vast; there is space to mention only a few. For a good general account, balanced and informative, the reader should consult James Collins's The Mind of Kierkegaard (Princeton

Augustana College Library, 1967) includes useful summaries and discussions of all the main published writings, while Louis Mackey's Kierkegaard: A Kind of Poet

provides a perceptive appraisal of its subject from a largely literary point of view. A comprehensive and philosophically orientated analysis of the structure of Kierkegaard's thought is to be found in Alastair Hannay's Kierkegaard
